instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 - no green light wont power on
threads.message:
macbook came in not working with no green light and not coming on, 

replaced U7100 and it worked, charged it to 100% and customer took it back 

customer plugged in his charger and it looks like that killed it again, 

missing green light again, replaced U7100 AGAIN, but this time no luck

D7005 pin 1- 16.54V     PIN 2 - 12.6V    PIN 3 - 16.27V

PP3V42_G3H - 3.4V

PM_SLP_S4_L - missing  does not pulse,

threads.title: 820-4924 - no green light wont power on
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H exact voltage?
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

threads.title: 820-4924 - no green light wont power on
820-4924 - no green light wont power on
threads.message:
Post U7000/1 voltages.
Did you try another DCIN board?

threads.title: 820-4924 - no green light wont power on
threads.message:
issue was the DC Jack, i had total of 3 bad ones, such a waste of time, sorry

Thank you guys, solved!

threads.title: 820-4924 - no green light wont power on
threads.message:
Is an easy repair.
There should be burnt small resistor/coil in serie with central pin.
